connector.description: Call another endpoint in the same CamelContext asynchronously.

camel.source.endpoint.size.name: camel.source.endpoint.size
camel.source.endpoint.size.description: The maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e., the number of messages it can hold). Will by default use the defaultSize set on the SEDA component.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.description: Number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.limitConcurrentCon.name: camel.source.endpoint.limitConcurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.limitConcurrentCon.description: Whether to limit the number of concurrentConsumers to the maximum of 500. By default, an exception will be thrown if an endpoint is configured with a greater number. You can disable that check by turning this option off.

camel.source.endpoint.multipleConsumers.name: camel.source.endpoint.multipleConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.multipleConsumers.description: Specifies whether multiple consumers are allowed. If enabled, you can use SEDA for Publish-Subscribe messaging. That is, you can send a message to the SEDA queue and have each consumer receive a copy of the message. When enabled, this option should be specified on every consumer endpoint.

camel.source.endpoint.pollTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.pollTimeout.description: The timeout used when polling. When a timeout occurs, the consumer can check whether it is allowed to continue running. Setting a lower value allows the consumer to react more quickly upon shutdown.

camel.source.endpoint.purgeWhenStopping.name: camel.source.endpoint.purgeWhenStopping
camel.source.endpoint.purgeWhenStopping.description: Whether to purge the task queue when stopping the consumer/route. This allows to stop faster, as any pending messages on the queue is discarded.

camel.source.endpoint.queue.name: camel.source.endpoint.queue
camel.source.endpoint.queue.description: Define the queue instance which will be used by the endpoint

camel.component.vm.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.vm.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.vm.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.vm.concurrentConsumers.name: camel.component.vm.concurrentConsumers
camel.component.vm.concurrentConsumers.description: Sets the default number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

camel.component.vm.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.vm.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.vm.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.vm.queueSize.name: camel.component.vm.queueSize
camel.component.vm.queueSize.description: Sets the default maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e., the number of messages it can hold).
